abstract.text: A menu element that performs its action in a selector.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object when you want a menu element that performs its action in a selector available in the responder chain.

code: // Create a selector-based action to use as a menu element.
// Use the .displayInline option to avoid displaying the menu as a submenu,
// and to separate it from the other menu elements using a line separator.
// Insert the menu into the File menu before the Close menu.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
Methods that associate a unique identifier with elements in your user interface.
A menu element that performs its action in a closure.
A menu element that performs its action in a selector.
The selector identifying the action method called after the user selects the command.
An array of alternative actions to take for the command.
The attributes indicating the style of the command.
Creates a command with the specified title, image, action, and property list.
Creates a command with the specified title, image, action, property list, and alternative commands.
An elaborated title that explains the purpose of the command.
The command’s image.
Creates a command from data in an unarchiver.
Creates a command with the specified title, image, action, property list, alternative commands, discoverability title, attributes, and state.
Creates a command with the specified title, subtitle, image, action, property list, alternative commands, discoverability title, attributes, and state.
An object that contains data to associate with the command.
The state of the command.
The command’s title.
An object representing an alternative action for a command.
A value that identifies a command as a Share menu.
A placeholder menu element that the system replaces with the result of the block’s completion handler.
An object that specifies a key press perform on a hardware keyboard and the resulting action.
An object representing a menu, action, or command.
Attributes that determine the style of the menu element.
Constants that indicate the state of an action- or command-based menu element.
An interface for an object that represents a menu element without child elements.
Provide quick access to useful actions by adding menus and keyboard shortcuts to your Mac app built with Mac Catalyst.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Adding menus and shortcuts to the menu bar and user interface

abstract.text: Add menus to your user interface, with built-in button support and bar-button items, and create custom menu experiences.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Adopting menus and UIActions in your user interface

abstract.text: A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
